title: Understanding Le Chatelier's Principle
text: Le Chatelier's Principle states that if a dynamic equilibrium is disturbed by changing the conditions, the position of equilibrium shifts to counteract the change and restore equilibrium.

title: Effect of Adding Reactants
text: When more of a reactant is added to a system at equilibrium, the system will shift to reduce the concentration of the added reactant. This usually means the equilibrium will shift towards the products.

title: Direction of Equilibrium Shift
text: In the reaction $$CO_2$$ (g) + $$H_2$$ (g)⇌CO (g)+ $$H_2 O$$ (g), adding more $$CO_2$$ will increase the concentration of $$CO_2$$. According to Le Chatelier's Principle, the system will shift to the right to produce more CO and $$H_2 O$$.
